channel.title: Guji on fREW Schmidt's Clog (Coffee Blog)
channel.description: Recent content in Guji on fREW Schmidt's Clog (Coffee Blog)

item.title: Ethiopia Wet Process Hambela Hassan
item.description: Sweet Maria’s (wbm) Delicious and delicate, this wet processed lot from Hambela Hassan is as sweet as it is floral, complex top notes burgeoning from the cups of light and middle roasts, and vibrant acidity helps construct a dynamic cup. The dry fragrance has perfumed florals, with a smell of peaches and cream, and a soft hint of vanilla. The wetted grounds of City roasts extend an aroma of peach, apricot, and nectarine, fruited smells with the volume of a natural process coffee, but more tea-like, and delicate in nature.

item.title: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain Taaroo
item.description: Sweet Maria’s ([wbm]) This is a very unique flavor profile. From the dry grounds, berry and spice notes are clear, as well as malt sugars and honey. My lightest roasts have a graham cracker wet aroma, with a lemon bar like smell as well. City+ level has more honey sweetness, prominent berry tones, and sweet spice notes of ginger, and herbs. A floral jasmine tea note and spice accents come through clearly in the cup, and vibrant citrus weaves through it all.
